summary: The bill, titled the Allowing Contractors to Choose Employees for Select Skills Act (ACCESS Act), aims to amend U.S. Code Title 41 to prohibit minimum education requirements for contractor personnel in federal solicitations. It requires justifications from contracting officers for any required education, encourages alternatives, and mandates OMB guidance. The bill also includes provisions for a GAO report on agency compliance and defines education and education requirements. It repeals a previous related law and clarifies the meaning of "executive agency".
